title: ICE using `impl ?Sized` in return position

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #[allow(dead_code)] fn uwu() -> impl ?Sized {} ``` [Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=d9a874743d0720987aee527d07811e56) ### Meta Error occurs on Stable 1.61.0 Beta 1.62.0-beta.2 Nightly 2022-05-19 ### Error output
Backtrace

``` Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground) error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:3 ~ playground[f439]::uwu) (NoSolution): could not prove Binder(TraitPredicate(, polarity:Positive), []) --> src/lib.rs:2:25 | 2 | fn uwu() -> impl ?Sized {} | ^^ | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_borrowck/src/type_check/canonical.rs:149:13 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1309:13 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fa0b5b141cd - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h22893a5306c091b4 at /rustc/fe5b13d681f25ee6474be29d748c65adcd91f69e/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7fa0b5b141cd - clone 30: 0x0 - note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.61.0 (fe5b13d68 2022-05-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `playground` ```
